FuncDef:
The vlan-group command creates a VLAN group and displays the VLAN group view.
The undo vlan-group command deletes a VLAN group.

By default, no VLAN group is configured on sub-interfaces.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the VLAN group ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario

Assume that QinQ has been configured on edge devices on a carrier network. In the following situations:

The network administrator needs to deploy separate QoS policies for various services. This ensures that service traffic with high priorities is more reliably transmitted over the network and helps to improve user experience.
The network administrator needs to view QinQ packet statistics to check the device status.

Run the vlan-group command to create a VLAN group.

Configuration Impact

After a VLAN group is created, you can configure the working mode for the VLAN group, enable VLAN group-based QinQ packet statistics, and view QinQ packet statistics.

Follow-up Procedure


Perform any of the following configuration steps:


Run the dot1q termination vid low-pe-vid [ to high-pe-vid ] vlan-group group-id command in the view of a sub-interface for Dot1q VLAN tag termination to associate the VLAN IDs to be terminated by the sub-interface with the VLAN group.
Run the qinq termination pe-vid pe-vid [ to high-pe-vid ] ce-vid low-ce-vid [ to high-ce-vid ] vlan-group group-id command in the view of a sub-interface for QinQ VLAN tag termination to associate the VLAN IDs to be terminated by the sub-interface with the VLAN group.
Run the qinq stacking vid low-ce-vid [ to high-ce-vid ] vlan-group group-id command in the view of a QinQ stacking sub-interface to associate the outer VLAN ID with the VLAN group.

2.Run the group mode command in the VLAN group view to configure the working mode for the VLAN group.
3.Run the statistic enable (VLAN group view) command in the VLAN group view to enable VLAN group-based QinQ packet statistics.
Precautions

Precautions

If you configure vlan-group after you run the qinq stacking vid command on an Ethernet sub-interface, the qinq stacking vid command cannot be run.
